meanings.definition: A person who is unkind or cruel.
meanings.sent1: The meanies at school always pick on others.
meanings.sent2: I don't want to play with the meanies who are mean to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The meanies in the story learned to be kind in the end.
meanings.sent4: Bullying is like a dark cloud following the meanies around.
meanings.sent5: The image of the meanies teasing the little boy stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: The average of a set of numbers.
meanings.sent1: Let's calculate the meanies of these numbers to find the average.
meanings.sent2: The meanies of the test scores showed improvement from last time.
meanings.sent3: The meanies of the temperatures this week was higher than usual.
meanings.sent4: The meanies of the data points helped us see the overall trend.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the meanies helps us see the big picture of the data.

meanings.definition: To intend to convey or indicate.
meanings.sent1: I didn't meanies to hurt your feelings with my comment.
meanings.sent2: She meanties to say thank you for the thoughtful gift.
meanings.sent3: He meanties to be funny, but his joke fell flat.
meanings.sent4: The tone of her voice meanties she was upset about something.
meanings.sent5: His gesture meanties more to her than any words could express.
